Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: @artik123 i have not read all of it, but what is the risk of default? If you have to trust someone to give you the principle back, would even 10% be enough for you to do that?

Author: artik123#2884
Content:
I'm not saying that it's good to trust someone with the loan. All I'm saying, if technically feasible, he should get at least some of the rewards.
All else being equal, he may lose on both ends since usdk is depreciating at 2% yearly rate and kmd 5% rewards are already integrated in current market price

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you feel that KMD will decrease 7% in the next year, it even makes sense to lock it and withdraw stablecoin

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: nobody is getting paid interest and nobody has to pay interest

Author: artik123#2884
Content: "All else being equal"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you are able to sell partial equity (without technically selling it) and get freely tradeable stablecoins

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and are able to close the account, all with just txfees to pay

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you imagine using BTC as collateral, there is no 5% rewards to be debating about

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and anybody that is paying you interest for you to deposit BTC, is lending it to someone else at a higher rate

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD system is NOT a deposit and get interest so someone can loan it out to get paid a higher rate of interest

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is not that at all

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is a system that allows people to have KMD and at anytime, borrow against it using the blockchain without paying any interest. in KMD case the monthly rewards are lost, but that wont really matter to someone who is outside the KMD now as they are not used to it. very few coins pay rewards

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: by the time someone is complaining that they dont get the 5% rewards by using this system, they at least understand a lot more about KMD than they did before

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the KMD is kept in a federated multisig that requires long term commitment and availability, it is not exactly the notary nodes, but rather composed of 13 msig operators, most of which used to be notaries. but all are long term community members

Author: artik123#2884
Content: So it was a political decision?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: theoretically if this became a deposit and get paid interest system which then charges someone else to borrow. then it would be charging the same person as the same person is depositing and issuing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there was no campaigning involved to be one of the 13

Author: mobipoi#5774

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: What don't you understand about the stable coin?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe there is someone that can make a video from the existing info?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the main idea is that it decentralizes the money supply creation, so each person can choose to create new stablecoins. based on overall demand, which is expected to go up as the price goes up, more stablecoins are issued. once issued they exist independently. of course the issuing accounts are owing the amount of stablecoins issued, so in addition to stablecoin usage, the stablecoin also enables one to gain the arbitrage from liquidation.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if to add that to the percentage gained by having stablecoins, it could become much more than double digit percentage as the target is 5% arbitrage gain. and there is not need to wait a year for it, just need to find an over leveraged account that can be liquidated

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this income production method i dont believe is availble for the other stablecoins. so the issuers do get something more than just the stablecoins in exchange for locking their KMD

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
deposit KMD, then issue stablecoins up to max of 80%.
these coins can then be used for anything and are not restricted in any way, and anybody can issue them
the special function of the stablecoins in addition to being pegged to EUR is that they are needed to liquidate delinquent accounts. this is a 5% per instance revenue source.
